faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: The course is an introduction to the main events and persons who have shaped British history, their historical importance and the role they have played in determining the course of British history from prehistoric times to the present. The course is richly illustrated with pictorial material.
description.et: Kursuse jooksul käsitletakse briti ajaloo kujunemisel määravaks osutunud sündmusi ja isikuid ülevaatlikul viisil, tuues välja nende ajaloolise tähtsuse ja rolli, mida nad mängisid sündmuste arengus alates eelajaloost kuni tänapäevani. Kursust illustreerib rikkalik pildimaterjal.

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to give an overview of the history of Britain and the colonies and dominions of the British Empire to the extent necessary for following British cultural history and providing a basis for studying English literature and the history of the English language within the framework of the BA and MA programmes at the English Department. The course and all the materials are in English.
objectives.et: Kursuse eesmärgiks on anda ülevaade Suurbritannia ja Briti impeeriumi erinevate kolooniate ja hilisemate dominioonide ajaloost ulatuses, mis võimaldaks üliõpilastel orienteeruda inglise keelt kõnelevate maade kultuuriloos ja oleks baasiks nii inglise kirjanduse kui ka inglise keele ajaloo omandamisel inglise filoloogia bakalaureuse ja magistratuuri õppekavade raames. Kursust loetakse  ja kursuse materjalid on inglise keeles.

learning_outcomes.en: By the end of the course the student should have a grasp of the main events and key players in British history, be able to place them in the proper historical context and have an overview of the mutual historical and cultural ties between the English-speaking countries.
learning_outcomes.et: Kursuse lõpuks on peaks üliõpilane olema võimeline orienteeruma briti ajaloo tähtsündmustes ja -isikutes, suutma panna nad ajaloolisesse konteksti ja omama ülevaadet inglise keelt kõnelevate maade omavahelistest ajaloolistest ja kultuurilistest seostest.

independent_work.et: Üliõpilase iseseisev töö seisneb eksamiks valmistumises ja õppematerjalidega tutvumises. Kursuse materjalid leiate aadressilt sisu.ut.ee/pilvirajamae ja Moodle'st.

grade_preconditions.et: Eksamile kvalifitseerumiseks peate osalema 30-st loengust vähemalt 25-l. Kohalolekut kontrollitakse.

grade_evaluation.et:
Kirjalik eksam toimub klassis pliiatsi ja paberiga. 

Eksamitöö koosneb 10 küsimusest, mis valitakse juhuslikult  kordamisküsimuste loendist. Neile tuleks anda lühikesed ja ülevaatlikud vastused, mis näitavad materjali täielikku mõistmist. 


Isikliku arvuti, telefoni, väljatrükitud materjalide või tehisaru kasutamine pole lubatud. 

Tagasiside oma tulemuse kohta leiad Moodle'ist eksami kuupäeva alt.

Materjalist parema arusaamise hõlbustamiseks tuleb iga kuu lõpus sooritada progress test.
See sisaldab ühte kordamisküsimust eelneva kuu jooksul iseseisvaks uurimiseks ette nähtud küsimustest ja kestab 15 minutit. Kui kõik kolm testi saavad positiivse hinde, vabaneb üliõpilane eksamitesti esimesele 5 küsimusele vastamisest, 50% lõpphindest on juba sooritatud.

Kui positiivseid tulemusi on alla kolme, tuleb eksamil vastata kõigile 10 eksamiküsimusele. 

Progress testi ei saa uuesti sooritada. Tagasiside testide kohta leiab Moodle'ist testikuupäeva alt.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

description.et:
The Celts in Britain and their legacy.
Caesar in Britain.
The Roman occupation of Britain and its legacy.
Christianity in Roman Britain.

The coming of the Angles, Saxons, Jutes, Frisians to Britain.
The 7 Anglo-Saxon kingdoms.

St Patrick and the Christianization of Ireland.
St Columba and the Irish Christian mission to Iona.
St Aidan and the Irish Christian mission to Northumbria.
St Augustine and the Roman Catholic mission to Kent. The Synod of Whitby 664.

Alfred the Great and the rise of Wessex to cultural pre-eminence.
Danelaw and other Viking territories in the British Isles.
Æthelred/Ethelred the Unready and Danegeld.
Canute/Cnut.

The Vikings of Normandy.
Feudalism and the manor system.
The Norman Conquest 1066.

The House of Anjou/the Plantagenets/the Angevins.
The Anglo-Norman invasion of Ireland, the Pale.

Magna Carta 1215.
Simon de Montfort’s Parliament of 1265.
The Model Parliament of 1295.

Edward I’s conquest of North Wales.
Kenneth MacAlpin and the unification of Scotland.

The Anglo-Norman invasion of Scotland.
The Scottish Wars of Independence 1286-1371.
The Hundred Years War 1337-1453.
The decline of the manor system.
The Wars of the Roses 1455-1485.

The House of Tudor.
The English Reformation.

The Protestantism of Edward VI’s reign.
The restored Catholicism of Mary I.

Elizabeth I and the Church of England /Anglican Church, the Thirty-nine Articles.
The Scottish Reformed Church/the Kirk.

The House of Stuart.
The Stuart ‘divine right of kings’.
Charles I’s ‘tyranny’.
Archbishop William Laud’s controversial church reforms.
The Civil War.

Regicide 1649.
The Commonwealth 1649-1660.

Restoration 1660.
The emergence of the two-party system, the Whigs and the Tories.

The Glorious Revolution 1688.
The Bill of Rights 1689, the Act of Settlement 1701.

The War of the Spanish Succession/the Marlborough Wars 1701-1714.
The Act of Union with Scotland 1707.

The House of Hanover.
Robert Walpole and the Cabinet System
The Jacobite Rebellions of 1708, 1715, 1745.

The War of the Austrian Succession 1740-1748.
The Seven Years War 1756-1763.
The British East India Company and the British expansion in India.
The American War of Independence 1775-1783.

Canada as a British colony.
Australia as a British colony.
New Zealand as a British colony.
The British expansion in South Africa.
The Great Trek and the foundation of the two independent Boer republics.

The Napoleonic Wars 1793-1815. 	
The Peterloo Massacre 1819.
The campaign for parliamentary reform from mid C18 into the C20.

The Free Trade and Corn Law debates.
The Industrial Revolution.

The emergence of the Conservative Party.
The emergence of the Liberal Party.
The emergence of the Labour Party.

British expansion into the African interior.
The Boer Wars 1880-1881, 1899-1902.
The Indian Mutiny 1857-1858.
The British Raj in India.
The British expansion in Asia.

The Houses of Wettin and Windsor.
The movement for women’s emancipation and suffrage in the C19 and C20.

The campaign for the Irish Home Rule in the C19 and C20.
The problem of Ulster in the C20.
World War I 1914-1918.

World War II 1939-1945.
The establishment and breakdown of the welfare state.
